edu.ncsu.csc216.cash_register

Class CurrencyCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.cash_register.CurrencyCollection

  • public class CurrencyCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of currency for US dollars
    Author:
    SarahHeckman, jesse liddle - jaliddl2

    • Constructor Detail

      • CurrencyCollection

        public CurrencyCollection()
        Constructs the currency collection with default values

      • CurrencyCollection

        public CurrencyCollection(int initialCount)
        Constructs the currency collection with a default number of bill/coins as provided by the parameter
        Parameters:
        initialCount - the initial number of each bills/coins in the currency collection

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrencyAtIdx

        public Currency getCurrencyAtIdx(int idx)
        Returns the Currency at the given index.
        Parameters:
        idx - index in currency collection
        Returns:
        Currency at given index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the idx is out of bounds

      • modifyDenomination

        public void modifyDenomination(int value,
                               int count)
        Adds the number of a denomination to the currency slot that matches the given value. If the count is negative or the value doesn't match a value in the CurrencyCollection, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        value - the monetary value to increase
        count - the count of denomination
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is invalid.

      • depositCurrencyCollection

        public void depositCurrencyCollection(CurrencyCollection deposit)
        Adds the currency in the payment to the current CurrencyCollection.
        Parameters:
        deposit - amount to add

      • refundByAmount

        public CurrencyCollection refundByAmount(int refund)
        Returns a CurrencyCollection containing the bills and coins that make up the refunded amount if available in the current CurrencyCollection. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if there is not exact change.
        Parameters:
        refund - amount to refund
        Returns:
        CurrencyCollection with the refunded currency
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is not exact change in the current CurrencyCollection.

      • getCurrencyCollection

        public Currency[] getCurrencyCollection()
        Returns the currency collection
        Returns:
        the currency collection

      • getBalance

        public int getBalance()
        Returns the balance. Since we are representing physical whole coins, we're storing the amount as an int. Divide by 100.00 to see the double version of the currency collection.
        Returns:
        the balance.
